titleStmt.title: By the Maior of London where as a very rich lo[t]terie generall hath now lately bene erected by the order of our [m]ost dread soueraigne Lady, the Queenes most excellent M[a]iestie, and by Hir Highnesse commaundement since publish[ed] within this Hir Highnesse citie of London, the xxiii daye of August, in the ix yeare of Hir Maiesties most prosperous raigne ...
titleStmt.author: City of London (England). Lord Mayor (1567 : Martin)

titleStmt.title: By the Maior of London where as a very rich lo[t]terie generall hath now lately bene erected by the order of our [m]ost dread soueraigne Lady, the Queenes most excellent M[a]iestie, and by Hir Highnesse commaundement since publish[ed] within this Hir Highnesse citie of London, the xxiii daye of August, in the ix yeare of Hir Maiesties most prosperous raigne ...
titleStmt.author: City of London (England). Lord Mayor (1567 : Martin)
Martin, Roger, Sir, fl. 1567.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Henrie Bynneman, dwelling in Pater noster rowe, at the signe of the Marmayde,

notesStmt.note: Other title information taken from first six lines of text.
Proclamation regarding lottery of 1567.--Cf. STC (2nd ed.).
Imperfect: creased with slight loss of print.
